question.text: Read the following statement and choose the CORRECT option.

options.text: Blood cells secrete fibers of structural protein called collagen
Osteocytes are present in fluid filled cavity called Lamellae

solution.text: Blood and Lymph are fluid connective tissue. These tissues do not have fibres and thus collagen or elastin are also absent. Osteocytes are bone forming cells. These are present in a bone cavity called Lacunae that also has extensions known as canaliculi. Lamellae are concentric layers of compact bone surrounding the haversian canal in mammals. Striated fibres are unbranched and show striations. Basophils are Granulocytes. These are types of Leukocytes. These are  <math><mn>0</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi></math>  of the total WBC's. These secrete substances like Histamine, Serotonin and heparin. Histamine is a Vasodilator. Serotonin mainly acts as Vasoconstrictor while Heparin is an anticoagulant. Thus basophils are non-phagocytic.
